body.p: CG Collector Node reads a batch of output records from the database, sets a local sequence number for each of them and sends them forward in Data Refinery internal format.

Once CG Collector Node picks up a batch for processing, the batch is locked so that no other collector node picks it up at the same time. The lock is released when the batch has been distributed or latest when the timeout for batch processing has expired. If the timeout expires, the batch is marked as expired and another CG Collector Node can pick it up for processing. Expired batches are prioritized over new batches, so that they are handled as soon as possible.
CG Collector Node reads records in a batch in parallel, so the order of output records is subject to change.
